greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of graphs with n vertices with vertex cover number k-1.
comment: Aside from trailing 1's, same as A115196.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..91 (first 13 rows, after Brendan McKay data in A263341)
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Vertex Cover
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Vertex Cover Number
example: \bar K_3 (1 graph) has vertex cover number 0
K_1\cup K_2 and P_3 (2 graphs) have vertex cover number 1
K_3=C_3 (1 graph) has vertex cover number 2
Here, \bar denotes graph complementation and \cup denotes (disjoint) graph union.
xref: Cf. A115196 (number of graphs on n nodes with clique number k), A263341.
results.author: _Eric W. Weisstein_, May 18 2017
ext: Terms a(46) and beyond from _Brendan McKay_ added by _Andrew Howroyd_, Feb 19 2020
